etymologies: early 17th century (in an earlier sense). Partly (i) from classical Latin verberātiōn-, verberātiō action of flogging (as a punishment), action of beating up, thrashing from verberāt-, past participial stem of verberāre + -iō;

definitions: The action of beating or striking so as to cause damage, pain, or injury; especially flogging or scourging.
